page.title: 01A Rural Landscape
page.content: This block is predominantly rural, with a number of farms scattered over the whole area, utilizing the land in both pasture and arable farming. The Shropshire Union Canal runs through the southern area of the block and there is also a reservoir which serves the area. The block covers the area of Cheswardine which is a small village with a very limited number of amenities and services for the local inhabitants. Dances, Bingo and concerts are held in Cheswardine Hall for the local people. Two public houses also serve the community, there are a couple of food shops but the nearest town, Market Drayton, provides a more varied selection of shops and services to the community. Within the block there are other concentrations of buildings which make up small communities such as Soudley &
